SEARCH
Package main.java.neat.config

Class NEATConfig

java.lang.Object
main.java.neat.config.NEATConfig
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class NEATConfig extends Object implements Serializable
Configuration class for NEAT (NeuroEvolution of Augmenting Topologies) algorithm. This class encapsulates all customizable parameters that control the NEAT evolutionary process. It serves as a central configuration hub, allowing fine-tuning of: - Population dynamics - Speciation mechanisms - Genome structure and initialization - Mutation rates and behaviors - Termination conditions - Selection mechanisms The class is designed to be immutable after construction and is typically created using the NEATConfigBuilder to provide a fluent configuration API.
Author:
Taher Joudeh
See Also:

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static enum 
    NEATConfig.CONNECTIVITY
    Defines the initial connectivity patterns for creating new genomes.
    static enum 
    NEATConfig.DISTRIBUTION
    Defines the probability distribution types used for initializing weights, biases, and other numeric parameters.
    static enum 
    NEATConfig.FITNESS_CRITERION
    Defines the optimization direction for fitness evaluation.
    static enum 
    NEATConfig.SELECTION_TYPE
    Defines the selection methods used for choosing parent genomes during reproduction.
    static enum 
    NEATConfig.SPECIES_FITNESS_FUNCTION
    Defines how to calculate the fitness of a species from its member genomes.

  • Method Details

    • getPopulationSize

      public int getPopulationSize()
      Returns the size of the population. This value determines how many genomes exist in each generation.
      Returns:
      The number of genomes in the population

    • getFitnessCriterion

      public NEATConfig.FITNESS_CRITERION getFitnessCriterion()
      Returns the fitness criterion used for evaluation. Determines whether the algorithm aims to maximize or minimize fitness values.
      Returns:
      The fitness criterion (MIN or MAX)

    • isFitnessTermination

      public boolean isFitnessTermination()
      Indicates whether the evolution should terminate upon reaching a fitness threshold.
      Returns:
      true if evolution should stop when fitness threshold is reached, false otherwise

    • getFitnessTerminationThreshold

      public double getFitnessTerminationThreshold()
      Returns the fitness threshold for termination. Evolution stops when the best genome's fitness reaches this value (if fitnessTermination is true).
      Returns:
      The fitness threshold value

    • isGenerationTermination

      public boolean isGenerationTermination()
      Indicates whether the evolution should terminate after a specific number of generations.
      Returns:
      true if evolution should stop after a fixed number of generations, false otherwise

    • getGenerationTerminationThreshold

      public int getGenerationTerminationThreshold()
      Returns the generation threshold for termination. Evolution stops after this many generations (if generationTermination is true).
      Returns:
      The maximum number of generations to run

    • getSpeciesFitnessFunction

      public NEATConfig.SPECIES_FITNESS_FUNCTION getSpeciesFitnessFunction()
      Returns the method used to calculate species fitness from member genome fitnesses. This affects which species are considered fit for reproduction and survival.
      Returns:
      The species fitness function (MIN, MAX, MEAN, or MEDIAN)

    • getStagnation

      public int getStagnation()
      Returns the number of generations with no improvement before a species is considered stagnant. Stagnant species may be eliminated to make room for innovation.
      Returns:
      The stagnation threshold in generations

    • getSpeciesElitism

      public int getSpeciesElitism()
      Returns the number of species to preserve even if they stagnate. This ensures diversity by maintaining some historical lineages.
      Returns:
      The number of species protected from stagnation-based elimination

    • getElitism

      public int getElitism()
      Returns the number of top performing genomes to preserve unchanged in each generation. These elite genomes pass to the next generation without mutation.
      Returns:
      The number of elite genomes preserved in each generation

    • getSurvivalThreshold

      public double getSurvivalThreshold()
      Returns the fraction of genomes in each species that are selected for reproduction. Only the top-performing genomes within this threshold reproduce.
      Returns:
      The survival threshold as a fraction between 0 and 1

    • getSelectionType

      public NEATConfig.SELECTION_TYPE getSelectionType()
      Returns the method used for selecting parent genomes during reproduction. Influences which genomes get to reproduce and how selection pressure is applied.
      Returns:
      The selection type (ROULETTE_WHEEL or TOURNAMENT)

    • getTournamentSize

      public int getTournamentSize()
      Returns the number of genomes to consider in tournament selection. Higher values increase selection pressure toward fitter genomes. Only used when selectionType is TOURNAMENT.
      Returns:
      The tournament size

    • getCompatabilityThreshold

      public double getCompatabilityThreshold()
      Returns the threshold for genome compatibility determining species membership. Genomes with compatibility distance below this threshold are considered the same species.
      Returns:
      The compatibility threshold value

    • getCompatibilityExcessCoefficient

      public double getCompatibilityExcessCoefficient()
      Returns the coefficient for excess genes in compatibility distance calculation. Higher values give more weight to excess genes when determining species membership.
      Returns:
      The excess genes coefficient

    • getCompatibilityDisjointCoefficient

      public double getCompatibilityDisjointCoefficient()
      Returns the coefficient for disjoint genes in compatibility distance calculation. Higher values give more weight to disjoint genes when determining species membership.
      Returns:
      The disjoint genes coefficient

    • getCompatibilityWeightCoefficient

      public double getCompatibilityWeightCoefficient()
      Returns the coefficient for weight differences in compatibility distance calculation. Higher values give more weight to connection weight differences when determining species membership.
      Returns:
      The weight difference coefficient

    • isDynamicCompatabilityThreshold

      public boolean isDynamicCompatabilityThreshold()
      Indicates whether the compatibility threshold should be adjusted dynamically. When true, the threshold is adjusted to maintain the target number of species.
      Returns:
      true if dynamic adjustment is enabled, false otherwise

    • getTargetNumberOfSpecies

      public int getTargetNumberOfSpecies()
      Returns the target number of species when using dynamic compatibility threshold. The compatibility threshold is adjusted to try to maintain this many species.
      Returns:
      The target number of species

    • getCompatabilityThresholdAdjustingFactor

      public double getCompatabilityThresholdAdjustingFactor()
      Returns the factor by which to adjust compatibility threshold when using dynamic adjustment. Controls how quickly the threshold is adjusted to reach the target number of species.
      Returns:
      The threshold adjustment factor

    • getNumberOfInputs

      public int getNumberOfInputs()
      Returns the number of input nodes in the network. This is determined by the problem domain (e.g., number of input features).
      Returns:
      The number of input nodes

    • getNumberOfOutputs

      public int getNumberOfOutputs()
      Returns the number of output nodes in the network. This is determined by the problem domain (e.g., number of classes in classification).
      Returns:
      The number of output nodes

    • getStartingHiddenNodes

      public int[] getStartingHiddenNodes()
      Returns the array specifying the number of hidden nodes in each hidden layer at initialization. For example, {5, 3} would create two hidden layers with 5 and 3 nodes respectively.
      Returns:
      Array containing the number of nodes in each hidden layer

    • getMaxNumberOfHiddenNodes

      public int getMaxNumberOfHiddenNodes()
      Returns the maximum number of hidden nodes allowed in the network. Prevents networks from growing too large during evolution.
      Returns:
      The maximum number of hidden nodes allowed

    • getStartingAggregationFunction

      public AggregationFunction.AGGREGATION_FUNCTION getStartingAggregationFunction()
      Returns the default aggregation function for new nodes. This function determines how a node combines its inputs.
      Returns:
      The default aggregation function

    • getStartingActivationFunctionForHiddenNodes

      public ActivationFunction.ACTIVATION_FUNCTION getStartingActivationFunctionForHiddenNodes()
      Returns the default activation function for new hidden nodes. This function determines how a hidden node transforms its aggregated input to output.
      Returns:
      The default activation function for hidden nodes

    • getStartingActivationFunctionForOutputNodes

      public ActivationFunction.ACTIVATION_FUNCTION getStartingActivationFunctionForOutputNodes()
      Returns the default activation function for new output nodes. This function determines how an output node transforms its aggregated input to output.
      Returns:
      The default activation function for output nodes

    • getAggregationConfig

      public AggregationConfig getAggregationConfig()
      Returns the configuration for allowed aggregation functions. This controls which aggregation functions can be used during evolution.
      Returns:
      The aggregation configuration

    • getActivationConfig

      public ActivationConfig getActivationConfig()
      Returns the configuration for allowed activation functions. This controls which activation functions can be used during evolution.
      Returns:
      The activation configuration

    • getInitConnectivity

      public NEATConfig.CONNECTIVITY getInitConnectivity()
      Returns the initial connectivity pattern for new genomes. Determines how nodes are connected when a network is first created.
      Returns:
      The initial connectivity pattern

    • getActivationDefault

      public ActivationFunction.ACTIVATION_FUNCTION getActivationDefault()
      Returns the default activation function for nodes created during evolution.
      Returns:
      The default activation function

    • getActivationMutationRate

      public double getActivationMutationRate()
      Returns the probability of mutating a node's activation function. Higher values make activation function mutations more frequent.
      Returns:
      The activation function mutation rate between 0 and 1

    • getAggregationDefault

      public AggregationFunction.AGGREGATION_FUNCTION getAggregationDefault()
      Returns the default aggregation function for nodes created during evolution.
      Returns:
      The default aggregation function

    • getAggregationMutationRate

      public double getAggregationMutationRate()
      Returns the probability of mutating a node's aggregation function. Higher values make aggregation function mutations more frequent.
      Returns:
      The aggregation function mutation rate between 0 and 1

    • getBiasInitMean

      public double getBiasInitMean()
      Returns the mean for initializing node bias values. Used with the bias initialization distribution.
      Returns:
      The bias initialization mean

    • getBiasInitStdev

      public double getBiasInitStdev()
      Returns the standard deviation for initializing node bias values. Used when bias initialization type is NORMAL.
      Returns:
      The bias initialization standard deviation

    • getBiasInitDistributionType

      public NEATConfig.DISTRIBUTION getBiasInitDistributionType()
      Returns the distribution type for initializing node bias values. Determines whether biases are initialized with uniform or normal distribution.
      Returns:
      The bias initialization distribution type

    • getBiasMaxValue

      public double getBiasMaxValue()
      Returns the maximum allowed value for node biases. Biases are clamped to this value during initialization and mutation.
      Returns:
      The maximum bias value

    • getBiasMinValue

      public double getBiasMinValue()
      Returns the minimum allowed value for node biases. Biases are clamped to this value during initialization and mutation.
      Returns:
      The minimum bias value

    • getBiasMutationPower

      public double getBiasMutationPower()
      Returns the power (magnitude) of bias mutations. Controls how much a bias can change in a single mutation.
      Returns:
      The bias mutation power

    • getBiasAdjustingRate

      public double getBiasAdjustingRate()
      Returns the probability of adjusting a node's bias during mutation. Higher values make small bias adjustments more frequent.
      Returns:
      The bias adjustment rate between 0 and 1

    • getBiasRandomizingRate

      public double getBiasRandomizingRate()
      Returns the probability of completely randomizing a node's bias during mutation. Higher values make complete bias replacements more frequent.
      Returns:
      The bias randomization rate between 0 and 1

    • getProbAddConnection

      public double getProbAddConnection()
      Returns the probability of adding a new connection during mutation. Controls how frequently new connections are added to the network.
      Returns:
      The add connection probability between 0 and 1

    • getProbRecurrentConnection

      public double getProbRecurrentConnection()
      Returns the probability that a new connection will be recurrent. Only relevant when feedForward is false.
      Returns:
      The recurrent connection probability between 0 and 1

    • getProbDeleteConnection

      public double getProbDeleteConnection()
      Returns the probability of deleting a connection during mutation. Controls how frequently connections are removed from the network.
      Returns:
      The delete connection probability between 0 and 1

    • enabledDefault

      public boolean enabledDefault()
      Indicates whether new connections are enabled by default. When false, new connections are created in a disabled state.
      Returns:
      true if new connections are enabled by default, false otherwise

    • getEnabledMutationRate

      public double getEnabledMutationRate()
      Returns the probability of toggling a connection's enabled status during mutation. Controls how frequently connections are enabled or disabled.
      Returns:
      The connection enabled status mutation rate between 0 and 1

    • getEnabledRateForEnabled

      public double getEnabledRateForEnabled()
      Returns the additional probability of toggling an enabled connection to disabled.
      Returns:
      The rate of maintaining enabled status for enabled connections

    • getEnabledRateForDisabled

      public double getEnabledRateForDisabled()
      Returns the additional probability of toggling a disabled connection to enabled.
      Returns:
      The rate of maintaining disabled status for disabled connections

    • isFeedForward

      public boolean isFeedForward()
      Indicates whether the network must be strictly feed-forward (no recurrent connections). When true, connections from later nodes to earlier nodes are not allowed.
      Returns:
      true if the network must be feed-forward, false if recurrent connections are allowed

    • getProbAddNode

      public double getProbAddNode()
      Returns the probability of adding a new node during mutation. Controls how frequently the network topology grows with new neurons.
      Returns:
      The add node probability between 0 and 1

    • getProbDeleteNode

      public double getProbDeleteNode()
      Returns the probability of deleting a node during mutation. Controls how frequently nodes are removed from the network.
      Returns:
      The delete node probability between 0 and 1

    • getResponseInitMean

      public double getResponseInitMean()
      Returns the mean for initializing node response values. Used with the response initialization distribution.
      Returns:
      The response initialization mean

    • getResponseInitStdev

      public double getResponseInitStdev()
      Returns the standard deviation for initializing node response values. Used when response initialization type is NORMAL.
      Returns:
      The response initialization standard deviation

    • getResponseInitDistributionType

      public NEATConfig.DISTRIBUTION getResponseInitDistributionType()
      Returns the distribution type for initializing node response values. Determines whether responses are initialized with uniform or normal distribution.
      Returns:
      The response initialization distribution type

    • getResponseMaxValue

      public double getResponseMaxValue()
      Returns the maximum allowed value for node responses. Responses are clamped to this value during initialization and mutation.
      Returns:
      The maximum response value

    • getResponseMinValue

      public double getResponseMinValue()
      Returns the minimum allowed value for node responses. Responses are clamped to this value during initialization and mutation.
      Returns:
      The minimum response value

    • getResponseMutationPower

      public double getResponseMutationPower()
      Returns the power (magnitude) of response mutations. Controls how much a response can change in a single mutation.
      Returns:
      The response mutation power

    • getResponseAdjustingRate

      public double getResponseAdjustingRate()
      Returns the probability of adjusting a node's response during mutation. Higher values make small response adjustments more frequent.
      Returns:
      The response adjustment rate between 0 and 1

    • getResponseRandomizingRate

      public double getResponseRandomizingRate()
      Returns the probability of completely randomizing a node's response during mutation. Higher values make complete response replacements more frequent.
      Returns:
      The response randomization rate between 0 and 1

    • isSingleStructuralMutation

      public boolean isSingleStructuralMutation()
      Indicates whether to allow only one structural mutation per genome per generation. When true, only one structural change (add/delete node/connection) can occur per genome.
      Returns:
      true if only one structural mutation is allowed, false otherwise

    • hasStructuralMutationAdvisor

      public boolean hasStructuralMutationAdvisor()
      Indicates whether to use a structural mutation advisor to guide mutation decisions. When true, the algorithm uses heuristics to determine when to make structural changes.
      Returns:
      true if using a structural mutation advisor, false otherwise

    • getWeightInitMean

      public double getWeightInitMean()
      Returns the mean for initializing connection weight values. Used with the weight initialization distribution.
      Returns:
      The weight initialization mean

    • getWeightInitStdev

      public double getWeightInitStdev()
      Returns the standard deviation for initializing connection weight values. Used when weight initialization type is NORMAL.
      Returns:
      The weight initialization standard deviation

    • getWeightInitDistributionType

      public NEATConfig.DISTRIBUTION getWeightInitDistributionType()
      Returns the distribution type for initializing connection weight values. Determines whether weights are initialized with uniform or normal distribution.
      Returns:
      The weight initialization distribution type

    • getWeightMaxValue

      public double getWeightMaxValue()
      Returns the maximum allowed value for connection weights. Weights are clamped to this value during initialization and mutation.
      Returns:
      The maximum weight value

    • getWeightMinValue

      public double getWeightMinValue()
      Returns the minimum allowed value for connection weights. Weights are clamped to this value during initialization and mutation.
      Returns:
      The minimum weight value

    • getWeightMutationPower

      public double getWeightMutationPower()
      Returns the power (magnitude) of weight mutations. Controls how much a weight can change in a single mutation.
      Returns:
      The weight mutation power

    • getWeightAdjustingRate

      public double getWeightAdjustingRate()
      Returns the probability of adjusting a connection's weight during mutation. Higher values make small weight adjustments more frequent.
      Returns:
      The weight adjustment rate between 0 and 1

    • getWeightRandomizingRate

      public double getWeightRandomizingRate()
      Returns the probability of completely randomizing a connection's weight during mutation. Higher values make complete weight replacements more frequent.
      Returns:
      The weight randomization rate between 0 and 1

    • getProbConnectInit

      public double getProbConnectInit()
      Returns the probability of creating each connection when using PARTIAL_* connectivity types. For partial connectivity patterns, each potential connection is created with this probability.
      Returns:
      The connection creation probability between 0 and 1
